quest.name: Blindsided
journal: Emeloth has a new worry to replace the old.

Not long after you address the issue of the two brothers' shortcomings, a new problem arises with J'khebica. In spite of her many promising qualities, it turns out she is remarkably clumsy, suffering repeated mishaps while applying the finishing touches. Unable to discern the cause, Emeloth bids you look in on the struggling apprentice. Speak with J'khebica and her fellows to see what you might be able to glean.

You learn from J'khebica that her struggles are relatively new. Meanwhile, the two brothers offer further insights, namely that she cannot reliably distinguish between the two of them, and that she invariably furrows her brows prior to failing. Take these revelations back to Emeloth for her consideration.

Listening in on your report, Kanchana posits that J'khebica's problem may lie with her vision, and Emeloth decides to check her eyesight to ascertain the possibility. Go and summon J'khebica for the test and put the mystery to rest.

It quickly becomes apparent that J'khebica's eyesight has deteriorated beyond what her current spectacles are able to correct. Kanchana suggests that you make her a new pair, which would double as the sample for the next task Emeloth has in mind for the apprentices. Synthesize a pair of spectacles for J'khebica, and present the finished product to your deputy for inspection.

※In the event you lose the materials or the synthesis ends in failure, you may try again by speaking with Kanchana.

The new spectacles do the trick, and J'khebica is fairly enraptured to have her vision back. Wido observes that, even in her semiblind state, J'khebica was still the better goldsmith, and he and Hal are spurred to greater effort. In this way, all three apprentices resume their training with the fire of their enthusiasm further stoked. Let their zeal inspire you as you continue striving for new heights in your craft.

※The next goldsmith quest will be available from Emeloth upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Synthesize a pair of precision spectacles Show the pair of precision spectacles to Emeloth.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Thanks to your inspired idea and extraordinary craftsmanship, we have addressed the issue of the two brothers' shortcomings, and may carry on their education.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Alas, another issue has arisen, this time with J'khebica. She possesses determination, artistic sense, and above all a love for jewelry. I was quite certain she would succeed as a goldsmith.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: But she is, for want of a better word, clumsy. Remarkably so. She falters at the most vital steps when applying the finishing touches, and ends up having to start from scratch. This has happened so many times now, she has become quite depressed.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Considering how reliable she is at molding, I cannot understand why she would struggle in this way. Could it be she puts too much pressure on herself, and it robs her of a steady touch?

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Whatever the cause might be, perhaps you will be able to discern it where I could not. Might I trouble you to look in on J'khebica, Schoolmaster? And the other two as well while you are at it. You are like to find them at the Sutler's Tent.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Might I trouble you to look in on the apprentices, Schoolmaster? You are like to find them at the Sutler's Tent.

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: Of late, J'khebica's shrill cry piercesss the air with clockwork regularity. Such a ssslump she must be sssuffering.

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: S-Schoolmaster, I'm at my wit's end! I keep on botching the finishing touches and it's just so frustrating and I don't know what to do anymore!

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: I was never clumsy like this in the past and though people say I talk in streams of thought I never rush my work, but for some reason my hands and fingers don't move as I will them.

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: I can't for the life of me work out what's wrong and it's driving me mad and I'm just about ready to give up!

dialogue.name: WIDO
dialogue.text: Thanks again for the other day, Chief. We've got our heads down an' together, tryin' to put out a ring what won't shame you.

dialogue.name: WIDO
dialogue.text: ...Eh? Have I noticed anythin' about J'khebica's work? Well, she's a sight better than me, an' that's takin' all her bunglin' into account. More's the pity 'cause she seems to know exactly what she wants to do.

dialogue.name: WIDO
dialogue.text: I ain't no expert─not yet anyway─but might be she could stand to slow it down some? I mean, outside o' work, she always gets me an' Hal mixed up. I won't deny the resemblance, but I'm clearly the better lookin' one.

dialogue.name: HAL
dialogue.text: M-Me? I've been watchin' Miss Emeloth, tryin' to imitate her movements. She's real graceful with her hands, y'know? Next time, maybe you could let us watch you, too?

dialogue.name: HAL
dialogue.text: ...J'khebica? Aye, she's been havin' a lot o' mishaps o' late, an' it's gotten her down.

dialogue.name: HAL
dialogue.text: Funny thing is you know when somethin's about to go wrong. She furrows her brows, lookin' real focused, like, then lets out a growl. An' the next moment, all her hard work's undone.

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: I think I've got the chisel perfectly lined up but then I swing the hammer and it's way off the mark... <sigh> Maybe I'm just not cut out to be a goldsmith...

dialogue.name: WIDO
dialogue.text: Me an' Hal, we wear different clothes, but even so J'khebica can't tell who's who half the time. At these odds, she might as well be guessin' blindfolded.

dialogue.name: HAL
dialogue.text: Right! I'm gonna learn as much as I can from you while you're here!

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: Everyone worries so for J'khebica. She is blessed to have sssuch caring friends.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Were you able to learn aught of J'khebica's situation?

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: She furrows her eyebrows before an instance of bungling, you say? And struggles to tell the two brothers apart besides...

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: It seemsss to me the problem liesss with her eyesss.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: I was aware of her poor eyesight, but I assumed that her spectacles corrected it...

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Hm, well, J'khebica is right there, so let us test her vision and ascertain the possibility. Schoolmaster, may I trouble you to summon her while Kanchana and I set things up?

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Let us test J'khebica's vision and see whether that is indeed the cause of her grief. Schoolmaster, may I trouble you to summon her while Kanchana and I set things up?

dialogue.name: WIDO
dialogue.text: Her spectacles might be the problem, you say? Well, that'd explain why she can't tell who's the better lookin' o' me an' Hal.

dialogue.name: HAL
dialogue.text: Er, what's goin' on? Is J'khebica alright?

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: In all likelihood, J'khebica's vision has sssince deteriorated and her spectaclesss no longer serve her needsss.

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: You wish to test my vision, Schoolmaster Surname? B-But of course!

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: So, I just stand here and should I take off my spectacles?

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: Nay, young goldsmith, pray leave them on.

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: Let us begin, then. Whose hand is raisssed? Miss Emeloth'sss...or mine?

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that's easy. Yours, Kanchana!

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: ...It honestly appears that way to you? By the gods, girl, what world have you been living in? How have you not already strolled off a cliff?

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: We have our anssswer. Her spectaclesss have outlived their usefulness.

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: Mayhap her ssschoolmaster would be so kind as to make her a new pair?

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Hm, it just so happens I had spectacles in mind for the next task. From the curves of the lenses to the joints of the frame, these items demand a high degree of precision, and are thus ideal for cultivating attention to detail.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: The spectacles you craft for J'khebica would also serve admirably as a sample for our apprentices. And for their added benefit, may I suggest that you make a demonstration of it?

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: So, the schoolmaster will make me a new pair of spectacles and it'll be our reference for the next task?

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Whenever you are ready, Forename. As before, if you are short of materials, Kanchana will furnish you with whatever you require.

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: Oh, to think that spectacles crafted by a renowned goldsmith such as you will soon grace my face and restore my vision! The excitement is almost too much to bear!

dialogue.name: WIDO
dialogue.text: You're gonna make J'khebica a new pair of specs? Heh, didn't see that comin'!

dialogue.name: HAL
dialogue.text: This time you're gonna do the craftin' in front of us, right? Right!?

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: If you need more materialsss for the spectaclesss, I have them here.

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: Ah, so J'khebica's spectaclesss are ready? Go on and let Emeloth know.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: How are the spectacles coming along?

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: Oh, praise be, I can see again! All the beauty of nature in its fullest brilliance extending as high as the heavens and as far as the horizon!

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: My world is so wide now I feel as though anything and everything is possible! Thank you, Schoolmaster, thank you from the bottom of my heart!

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: To look at your glee, it's a wonder you didn't realize the fault lay in your spectacles. At any rate, you may again work with confidence.

dialogue.name: WIDO
dialogue.text: She could hardly see worth a damn, but she could still do a sight better than us. We're gonna have to lift our game somethin' fierce. You hear me, Hal?

dialogue.name: HAL
dialogue.text: Loud an' clear, Wido. Loud an' clear.

dialogue.name: JKHEBICA
dialogue.text: These are the finest spectacles a girl could hope to own and I don't know how close we can get to such quality, but we're going to give it our all!

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Prior to this, J'khebica showed a glimpse of promise, but with her new spectacles I believe she is set to give us a veritable eyeful. Seeing this has served to stoke the fires within Wido and Hal, and we may expect much and more from them also.

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: They may be worksss in progress, but quickly are they taking shape. Ere long they will become goldsmiths in their own right.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: From our perspective they still have far to go, but they now have it in them to craft wares fit to grace shop displays.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: In anticipation of this, I've been consulting Master Marcel on finding purveyors willing to stock their handiwork.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Ours is an unknown name for now, but the day will come when people the realm over gather in droves seeking Crown Gemworks articles. It is to see such a day arrive that we labor.

dialogue.name: KANCHANA
dialogue.text: ...It occursss to me that if the spectaclesss are to serve as reference, would J'khebica not need to remove them? How would she carry out the work in that cassse?

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Oh. Right you are.

dialogue.name: EMELOTH
dialogue.text: Sh-Shall we say that this is part of the challenge? It would afford us a little more time to prepare for the next task...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In polishing your skills as a goldsmith, you have learned “Manipulation”!
